ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Inappropriate device settings (User error)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Device inspection revealed high volume and low sensitivity settings; restoring defaults resolved the performance decline.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Device failure
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to reported decline, but ruled out as the device functioned normally when settings were corrected.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Medical or cognitive change
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out by stable medical history and immediate restoration of performance with setting adjustments.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess word and sentence recognition in quiet for CI candidacy and post-op monitoring.
To evaluate functional hearing in noise (SNR loss) pre- and post-operatively.
To check datalogs and current user settings on the sound processor.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Pre-operative evaluation confirmed bilateral severe sensorineural hearing loss with poor speech recognition, meeting FDA criteria for cochlear implantation.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: CNC Phonemes: Right 64%, Left 51%, Bilateral 43%. CNC Words: Right 28%, Left 16%, Bilateral 24%. AzBio Quiet: Right 19%, Left 4%, Bilateral 36%.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: BKB-SIN SNR Loss: Right 12 dB, Left 15 dB, Bilateral 13 dB.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Post-operative evaluation revealed the patient was using inappropriate settings (Volume 8, Sensitivity 7). Testing confirmed poor performance with user settings (CI-only 30%) but dramatic improvement with recommended settings (CI-only 72%, Bimodal 88%), confirming the device was functioning well and the issue was user error.

tests.name: Device Inspection
tests.result_summary: Volume at 8 (high), Sensitivity at 7 (low). Default sensitivity is typically 12.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: User Settings: AzBio Quiet CI only 30%, Bimodal 42%. Recommended Settings: AzBio Quiet CI only 72%, Bimodal 88%.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: User Settings SNR Loss: Everyday 11 dB, Noise 8.5 dB, Focus 5.0 dB. Recommended Settings SNR Loss: Everyday 6.5 dB, Noise 3.5 dB, Focus 0 dB.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: At the 2-week follow-up, the patient reported his marriage had been saved and he could not believe how much better he was hearing. Patient is making judicious changes to the volume control setting as needed and selecting appropriate programs based on the listening environment.

proposed_items: Lock sensitivity control at 12 (with patient consent)
Decrease sensitivity breakpoint to 50 dB SPL to allow ASC to activate at lower input levels
counseling_actions: Explain the 'camera lens' analogy: changing sensitivity too much limits the range of sounds heard
Demonstrate how low sensitivity cuts off soft sounds and high volume compresses loud sounds
Review objective test results showing dramatic improvement with recommended settings
Advise avoiding frequent remote adjustments and allowing SmartSound automatic features to manage the environment
Counsel on optimal positioning (noise behind, speaker in front)

escalation.rationale_short: Issue resolved with counseling and setting adjustments; routine monitoring is appropriate.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor performance and ensure patient is using appropriate settings.

expected_outcome: Patient reported his marriage had been saved and he could not believe how much better he was hearing.
Patient is making judicious changes to the volume control setting as needed and selecting appropriate programs based on the listening environment.
